feed.title: RustSec Advisories
feed.subtitle: Security advisories filed against Rust crates

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0127: Vulnerability in cggmp21
entry.summary: CGGMP21 presignatures can be used in the way that significantly reduces security
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0127

CGGMP21 presignatures can be used in the way that significantly reduces security
Reported
November 24, 2025
Issued
November 25, 2025 (last modified: November 26, 2025)
Package
cggmp21 (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Categories
  • crypto-failure
Keywords
#hd-wallet #presignature #tss
Aliases
  • CVE-2025-66017
  • GHSA-8frv-q972-9rq5
References
  • https://www.dfns.co/article/cggmp21-vulnerabilities-patched-and-explained
Patched
no patched versions

Description

This attack is against presignatures used in very specific context:

  • Presignatures + HD wallets derivation: security level reduces to 85 bits
    Previously you could generate a presignature, and then choose a HD derivation path while issuing a partial signature via Presignature::set_derivation_path, which is malleable to attack that reduces target security level. To mitigate, this method has been removed from API.
  • Presignatures + "raw signing" (when signer signs a hash without knowing an original message): results into signature forgery attack
    Previously, you could use Presignature::issue_partial_signature with hashed message without ever providing original mesage. In new API, this method only accepts digests for which original message has been observed.

Patches

cggmp24 v0.7.0-alpha.2 release contains API changes that make it impossible to use presignatures in contexts in which it reduces security. Follow the migration guidelines to upgrade.

Workarounds

You can continue using un-patched versions of library as long as you don't use presignatures in said scenarios where it weakens system security. To be sure, migrate to patched version that excludes presignatures from being used in such scenarios.

References

Read our blog post to learn more.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0129: Vulnerability in cggmp21
entry.summary: Missing check in ZK proof in CGGMP21 Threshold Signing Protocol
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0129

Missing check in ZK proof in CGGMP21 Threshold Signing Protocol
Reported
November 24, 2025
Issued
November 25, 2025 (last modified: November 26, 2025)
Package
cggmp21 (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Categories
  • crypto-failure
Keywords
#zk-proof
Aliases
  • CVE-2025-66016
  • GHSA-m95p-425x-x889
References
  • https://www.dfns.co/article/cggmp21-vulnerabilities-patched-and-explained
Patched
  • >=0.6.3

Description

Vulnerability concerns a missing check in the ZK proof that enables an attack in which single malicious signer can reconstruct full private key.

Patches

  • cggmp21 v0.6.3 is a patch release that contains a fix that introduces this specific missing check.
  • However, we recommend upgrading to cggmp24 v0.7.0-alpha.2 in which we've introduced many other security checks as a precaution. Follow the migration guidelines to upgrade.

References

Read our blog post to learn more.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0126: Vulnerability in nftnl
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0126

Heap-buffer-overflow in nftnl::Batch::with_page_size (nftnl-rs)
Reported
October 18, 2025
Issued
November 25, 2025 (last modified: November 26, 2025)
Package
nftnl (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Categories
  • memory-corruption
Aliases
  • GHSA-2fjw-whxm-9v4q
References
  • https://github.com/mullvad/nftnl-rs/issues/76#issue-3528876468
Patched
  • >=0.8.0

Description

A heap-buffer-overflow vulnerability exists in the Rust wrapper for libnftnl, triggered via the nftnl::Batch::with_page_size constructor. When a small or malformed page size is provided, the underlying C code allocates an insufficient buffer, leading to out-of-bounds writes during batch initialization.

The flaw was fixed in commit 94a286f by adding an overflow check:

batch_page_size
    .checked_add(crate::nft_nlmsg_maxsize())
    .expect("batch_page_size is too large and would overflow");

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0130: Vulnerability in cggmp24
entry.summary: Missing check in ZK proof in CGGMP21 Threshold Signing Protocol
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0130

Missing check in ZK proof in CGGMP21 Threshold Signing Protocol
Reported
November 24, 2025
Issued
November 25, 2025 (last modified: November 26, 2025)
Package
cggmp24 (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Categories
  • crypto-failure
Keywords
#zk-proof
Aliases
  • CVE-2025-66016
  • GHSA-m95p-425x-x889
References
  • https://www.dfns.co/article/cggmp21-vulnerabilities-patched-and-explained
Patched
  • >=0.7.0-alpha.2

Description

Vulnerability concerns a missing check in the ZK proof that enables an attack in which single malicious signer can reconstruct full private key.

Patches

  • cggmp21 v0.6.3 is a patch release that contains a fix that introduces this specific missing check.
  • However, we recommend upgrading to cggmp24 v0.7.0-alpha.2 in which we've introduced many other security checks as a precaution. Follow the migration guidelines to upgrade.

References

Read our blog post to learn more.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

RUSTSEC-2025-0128

CGGMP21 presignatures can be used in the way that significantly reduces security
Reported
November 24, 2025
Issued
November 25, 2025 (last modified: November 26, 2025)
Package
cggmp24 (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Categories
  • crypto-failure
Keywords
#hd-wallet #presignature #tss
Aliases
  • CVE-2025-66017
  • GHSA-8frv-q972-9rq5
References
  • https://www.dfns.co/article/cggmp21-vulnerabilities-patched-and-explained
Patched
  • >=0.7.0-alpha.2

Description

This attack is against presignatures used in very specific context:

  • Presignatures + HD wallets derivation: security level reduces to 85 bits
    Previously you could generate a presignature, and then choose a HD derivation path while issuing a partial signature via Presignature::set_derivation_path, which is malleable to attack that reduces target security level. To mitigate, this method has been removed from API.
  • Presignatures + "raw signing" (when signer signs a hash without knowing an original message): results into signature forgery attack
    Previously, you could use Presignature::issue_partial_signature with hashed message without ever providing original mesage. In new API, this method only accepts digests for which original message has been observed.

Patches

cggmp24 v0.7.0-alpha.2 release contains API changes that make it impossible to use presignatures in contexts in which it reduces security. Follow the migration guidelines to upgrade.

Workarounds

You can continue using un-patched versions of library as long as you don't use presignatures in said scenarios where it weakens system security. To be sure, migrate to patched version that excludes presignatures from being used in such scenarios.

References

Read our blog post to learn more.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0125: Vulnerability in thread-amount
entry.summary: Resource Exhaustion (Memory and Handle Leaks) on Windows and macOS
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0125

Resource Exhaustion (Memory and Handle Leaks) on Windows and macOS
Reported
November 22, 2025
Issued
November 22, 2025
Package
thread-amount (crates.io)
Type
Vulnerability
Categories
  • denial-of-service
Keywords
#memory-leak #handle-leak #resource-exhaustion #windows #macos
Aliases
  • GHSA-jf9p-2fv9-2jp2
  • CVE-2025-65947
References
  • https://github.com/jzeuzs/thread-amount/pull/29
CVSS Score
7.5 HIGH
CVSS Details
Attack Vector
Network
Attack Complexity
Low
Privileges Required
None
User Interaction
None
Scope
Unchanged
Confidentiality Impact
None
Integrity Impact
None
Availability Impact
High
CVSS Vector
CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
Patched
  • >=0.2.2
Affected OSes
  • windows
  • macos
  • ios
Affected Functions
Version
thread_amount::is_single_threaded
  • <0.2.2
thread_amount::thread_amount
  • <0.2.2

Description

Affected versions of this crate contain resource leaks when querying thread counts on Windows and Apple platforms.

Windows

The thread_amount function calls CreateToolhelp32Snapshot but fails to close the returned HANDLE using CloseHandle. Repeated calls to this function will cause the handle count of the process to grow indefinitely, eventually leading to system instability or process termination when the handle limit is reached.

macOS / iOS

The thread_amount function calls task_threads (via Mach kernel APIs) which allocates memory for the thread list. The function fails to deallocate this memory using vm_deallocate. Repeated calls will result in a steady memory leak, eventually causing the process to be killed by the OOM (Out of Memory) killer.

Impact

Long-running applications (such as servers, daemons, or monitoring tools) that use this crate to periodically check thread counts will eventually crash due to resource exhaustion.

Mitigation

Upgrade to version 0.2.2 or later, which properly releases OS resources.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0123: opentelemetry-jaeger is unmaintained
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0123

opentelemetry-jaeger crate is unmaintained
Reported
November 17, 2025
Issued
November 18, 2025
Package
opentelemetry-jaeger (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unmaintained
References
  • https://crates.io/crates/opentelemetry-jaeger
Patched
no patched versions

Description

The opentelemetry-jaeger crate is deprecated and no longer actively maintained.

The Jaeger propagator implementation has been migrated to opentelemetry-jaeger-propagator.

More information and examples of using OTLP with Jaeger can be found in Introducing native support for OpenTelemetry in Jaeger and Exporting OTLP traces to Jaeger.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0124: rand_os is unmaintained
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0124

rand_os crate is unmaintained
Reported
November 17, 2025
Issued
November 18, 2025 (last modified: November 19, 2025)
Package
rand_os (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unmaintained
References
  • https://crates.io/crates/rand_os
Patched
no patched versions

Description

The rand_os crate is deprecated and no longer actively maintained, as OsRng is now part of rand_core.

If you are using this crate, consider upgrading to rand_core 0.5.1 or higher.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0120: json5 is unmaintained

RUSTSEC-2025-0120

json5 crate is unmaintained
Reported
November 16, 2025
Issued
November 18, 2025 (last modified: November 22, 2025)
Package
json5 (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unmaintained
References
  • https://github.com/callum-oakley/json5-rs/issues/51
Patched
no patched versions

Description

The json5 crate is no longer actively maintained. If you rely on this crate, consider switching to a recommended alternative.

Recommended alternatives

  • serde_json5
  • jsonc-parser
  • json-five

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.
